key_responsibilities: answering constituent requests for general information
requirements: excellent written and interpersonal communications skills
the ability to work long hours in a fast-paced, team environment

key_responsibilities: uncovering allegations of waste, fraud, abuse and mismanagement
requirements: outstanding written and oral communications skills
strong awareness of environmental and public health issues

key_responsibilities: serving as confidential assistant to Chief of Staff and Member
driving Member to meetings and appointments
providing assistance to scheduling and legislative teams
assisting the Committee in all aspects of its investigative work
researching and reviewing public data sources
preparing for and participating in witness interviews
requirements: outstanding organizational, research, and analytical skills
experience in government ethics, criminal law, civil litigation, administrative investigations and adjudications, depositions, investigative journalism, or financial accounting
experience with document review/management platforms and/or online research services (Lexis/Nexis, Westlaw, CLEAR)
familiarity with Congressional payroll and Hill office administrative work

key_responsibilities: acting as a liaison between constituent groups and Congresswoman Torres
maintaining an awareness and involvement in district affairs
representing the Congresswoman at public events
working with the Press Secretary to maintain Congresswoman Torres’ social media accounts
requirements: ability to handle difficult situations with courtesy, tact and compassion
ability to exercise a high degree of initiative
ability to work independently and use good judgment
knowledge of the cities, communities and issues of concern to the 35th Congressional District

key_responsibilities: working placement of stories in local district media
requirements: demonstrated experience working with various forms of media
ability to critically think of district implications

key_responsibilities: developing and implementing a coordinated and strategic communications plan
writing press releases, talking points, speeches and op-eds
pitching stories and responding to press inquiries
booking interviews on radio and television
managing congressional website, Facebook and Twitter accounts
producing a comprehensive weekly e-newsletter and regular print mailings to constituents
working closely with DC and district staff
managing portions of the office's mail operation
requirements: ability to work under short deadlines
comfortable with and show good judgment speaking on the record with press
ability to strategically connect DC policy with district press opportunities
at least 3 years’ experience in media relations or in journalism
